meanings.definition: The use of archaic or outdated language or expressions.
meanings.sent1: Her writing was filled with atticisms, making it hard for modern readers to understand.
meanings.sent2: The professor's speech was full of atticisms, causing confusion among the students.
meanings.sent3: The children found the old book amusing because of the atticisms used by the characters.
meanings.sent4: His insistence on using atticisms in his emails made his communication style seem out of touch.
meanings.sent5: The atticisms in the play brought a sense of nostalgia to the audience.

meanings.definition: A characteristic or feature of attic style or architecture.
meanings.sent1: The atticisms of the house included the unique dormer windows and sloping ceilings.
meanings.sent2: The atticisms of the building gave it a quaint and charming appearance.
meanings.sent3: The atticisms of the attic made it a cozy and inviting space for storage.
meanings.sent4: The atticisms of the architecture added a touch of history to the neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The atticisms of the design created a sense of warmth and comfort in the room.
